meanings.def: a small group of musicians who play popular music together, often with a singer or singers
examples: a rock/punk/jazz band
He plays drums in a band that he formed with some friends.
The band is/are playing a gig in Liverpool tonight.
She's a singer with a band.
There's nothing like the excitement of seeing a live band.
his fellow band members Paul McCartney, George Harrison and Ringo Starr
He formed a garage band with his friends.
He was accompanied onstage by his backing band.
They hired a Beatles tribute band to play at the reception.

meanings.def: a group of musicians who play brass and percussion instruments
examples: a military band
We heard a band strike up in the park.

meanings.def: a group of people who do something together or who have the same ideas, interests or achievements
examples: a band of outlaws/rebels
He persuaded a small band of volunteers to help.
They are members of a growing band of enthusiasts.
The two men are part of a dwindling band of veterans.
He is one of a select band of top class players.
The young Irishman joined the elite band of Formula One drivers this week.

meanings.def: a thin flat piece or circle of any material that is put around things, for example to hold them together or to make them stronger
examples: She always ties her hair back in a band.
All babies in the hospital have name bands on their wrists.
She wore a simple band of gold (= a ring) on her finger.

meanings.def: a line of colour or material on something that is different from what is around it
examples: a white plate with a blue band around the edge
The light had expanded in a broad band across the sky.
Short-wave radio uses the 20–50–metre band.

meanings.def: a range of numbers, ages, prices, etc. within which people or things are counted or measured
examples: the 25–35 age band
Which tax band do you fall into?

meanings.def: to put a band of a different colour or material around something
examples: be banded (+ adj.) Many insects are banded black and yellow.

meanings.def: to organize something into bands of price, income, etc.
examples: be banded Tax is banded according to income.
